Steve Freeman wrote:

> This is a nice idea that's been kicking around for a while, so it's good
> to see someone run with it. Alternatively, some people have tried doing
> clever things with class loaders (I've heard rumours of similar efforts
> in .Net).
> 
> My one caveat is that this makes mocking a testing technique, so it's
> good for working with external libraries. How do you get the (asserted)
> benefits of mocks as a design technique for new code?

Not that you asked me, but this feels like the wedge we need to drive 
into legacy code (code without tests) so that we can begin to refactor 
it. It's a shame that I don't work with this stuff more often, because I 
can't write about it intelligently for the book.

I invite Chad and others working in this direction to bombard me with 
references so that I can write an essay on the topic and include it in 
the book.

Thanks.
